#OpenBadges: because you want the right creds.  It starts by knowing what you have, what you don’t, and where to get them. [3/3]
#OpenBadges:  because “Standard B.A. competence at Tech” is unrefined.  For learners, creds are more valuable unbundled. [2/3]
#OpenBadges:  because the real frame of reference for life-long learning is not “institution” but “industry.” [1/3]

A key obstacle to open education is removed.  To accelerate it’s potential,  ask vendors to comply. Consider credentials designs anew.
We now have std to SHARE  CONTENT, achieve single SIGN ON, consolidate OUTCOMES DATA, and with this a global path to mobile CREDENTIALS.
#OpenBadges adopted alongside key interoperability standards #LTI, #CommonCartridge, and analytics std #Caliper.  Industrial strength.

Adaptive?  I’m wary of black boxes and some data science revolution.  But mildly adaptive, simple conditional, seems a clear improvement.

Infrastructure and platforms are well maturing and well financed, but content often mired in last epoch.  But new leaders are emerging.
Spoke today about my personal investment thesis in ed-tech.  In short, I’m focused on next generation digital curriculum.
